item.name: Arcane Battery
entries: This smooth, oval stone is etched with faintly glowing, magical symbols. While holding the battery, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to touch the battery to one magic item. If that magic item normally regains expended charges daily, it immediately regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges, and the battery loses its magic.

item.name: Brooch of the Elements
entries: The central jewel of this butterfly-shaped brooch swirls with multicolored iridescence.

The brooch has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you hits a target with an attack roll and deals damage, you can expend 1 charge and change one damage type the attack deals to one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder.

item.name: Fork of Eddy Summoning
entries: This Tiny tuning fork crackles with harmless, multicolored magical energy. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can tap the fork against any object to summon an {@creature Eldritch Eddy|NF} (see appendix B). The eddy appears in an unoccupied space as close to you as possible. The eddy is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your allies, and it obeys your commands. If you fail to command it, the eddy defends itself against attackers but takes no other actions. It takes its turn immediately after you on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count. The eddy disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. The fork can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Hat of Vortexes
entries: This hat has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and expend 1 charge while holding the hat to release a magical vortex from it. The vortex fills a 10-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} originating from you and lasts for 1 hour. While the vortex is present, its area is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.
You decide a vortex's visual details when you create it. For instance, the vortex might be multicolored or glittery.

item.name: Magen Handbell
entries: While holding this brass handbell, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to ring it and summon a {@creature Terran Magen|NF} (see appendix B). The magen appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 30 feet of yourself, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count. The magen disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. The bell can't be used this way again for {@dice 1d6} days.

entries.name: Berserk Magen
entries: Whenever the magen summoned by this item starts its turn Bloodied, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 6, the magen goes berserk.

While berserk, the magen no longer obeys your commands, and you can't dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. On each of its turns, the berserk magen attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough for the magen to move to and attack, the magen attacks an object. The magen remains berserk until it disappears, or until a creature holding the handbell takes an {@action Influence|XPHB} action and succeeds on a DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check to regain control of the magen.

item.name: Mask of Changed Appearance
entries: This jeweled mask has 3 charges. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend 1 charge and change your face's appearance. You can't make yourself look like a different person, but you can smooth or deepen your wrinkles, whiten your teeth, hide or accentuate bags under your eyes, or perform other minor cosmetic changes. While your appearance is changed, the mask has the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition. Your changed appearance lasts 1 hour.

entries.name: Regaining Charges
entries: The mask regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a 1, the mask explodes in a harmless cloud of sweet-swelling powder and is destroyed.

item.name: Mythallar Bracelet
entries: Three small, crystal beads made from a decommissioned mythallar are strung on this leather bracelet. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can pluck one bead from the bracelet to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) checks for 1 minute.
A bead disappears immediately after it's plucked. Once all three beads have been plucked, the bracelet loses its magic.

item.name: Mythallar Cloak
entries: This electric-blue cloak is studded with sewn-in crystals that are shards of a decommissioned mythallar. The cloak has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d10} expended charges daily at dawn.

While wearing the cloak, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and expend 1 charge to activate the cloak's magic. The magic lasts for 1 minute or until you end it early (no action required).

While the cloak's magic is active, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 30 feet and can hover. Additionally, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an attack roll and deal damage, you can cause the target to take an extra {@damage 1d4} Radiant damage. If you are aloft when the cloak's magic ends, you fall.
